alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Gove; Graham; Greeley; Logan; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 11:05AM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ MONDAY TO 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas. * WHEN...From 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Monday to 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be hazardous to not locally impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A small deviation in the track of the system may higher or slightly lower than current forecasted snowfall amounts. There also remains the potential that within the warning area that some swaths of higher snowfall amounts, potentially exceeding 12 inches are possible. Exact confidence in these specific areas are not known at this time. Strong north winds gusting around 60 mph especially south of I-70 are forecast which may lead to periods of near blizzard to blizzard conditions. Elsewhere near blizzard conditions are possible as winds gust 40-50 mph.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Decatur; Gove; Graham; Greeley; Logan; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace; Wichita
